content: This is a **timeline of Singaporean history**, comprising important legal and territorial changes and political events in Singapore and its predecessor states. To read about the background to these events, see [History of Singapore](/wiki/History_of_Singapore). See also the [list of years in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_years_in_Singapore). ## 11th to 12th century YearDateEvent1025The region was invaded and occupied by [Rajendra Chola](/wiki/Rajendra_Chola) of the [Chola empire](/wiki/Chola_empire) in India, although there has been no record of them visiting the island itself. ## 13th century YearDateEvent1299According to the *[Malay Annals](/wiki/Malay_Annals)*, the [Kingdom of Singapura](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Singapura) was founded by [Sang Nila Utama](/wiki/Sang_Nila_Utama), a prince of Srivijaya. The kingdom existed till 1398. ## 14th century YearDateEvent1320The [Mongol court](/wiki/Mongol_Empire) sends a mission to obtain elephants from *[Long Ya Men](/wiki/Long_Ya_Men)* (or *Dragon's Tooth Strait*), believed to be [Keppel Harbour](/wiki/Keppel_Harbour).1330The Chinese traveller [Wang Dayuan](/wiki/Wang_Dayuan) visits Temasek and records an attack by [Siam](/wiki/Siam), recording it down alongside Long Ya Men and [Ban Zu](/wiki/Ban_Zu).1398[Parameswara](/wiki/Parameswara_(sultan)), the last [Srivijayan](/wiki/Srivijaya) prince, flees from Temasek. ## 15th century YearDateEvent1414Temasek becomes part of the [Sultanate of Malacca](/wiki/Sultanate_of_Malacca) established by [Parameswara](/wiki/Parameswara_(sultan)). ## 16th century YearDateEvent151115 AugustMalacca fell and was sacked by [Afonso de Albuquerque](/wiki/Afonso_de_Albuquerque) of [Portuguese Empire](/wiki/Portuguese_Empire). See [Portuguese Malacca](/wiki/Portuguese_Malacca). ## 17th century YearDateEvent1613Portuguese burn down the trading outpost at the mouth of Singapore River.164114 JanuaryFall of Portuguese Malacca to Dutch. ## 19th century YearDateEvent181929 January[Sir Stamford Raffles](/wiki/Stamford_Raffles) arrives in Singapore with [William Farquhar](/wiki/William_Farquhar) to establish a trading post for the [British East India Company](/wiki/British_East_India_Company).6 FebruaryThe treaty is signed between [Sultan Hussein](/wiki/Hussein_Shah_of_Johor) of [Johor](/wiki/Johor), [Temenggong](/wiki/Temenggong) Abdul Rahman and [Sir Stamford Raffles](/wiki/Stamford_Raffles).William Farquhar is installed as the first [Resident of the settlement](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Residents_of_Singapore_(1819–1826)).1821[Singapore General Hospital](/wiki/Singapore_General_Hospital) was established.1822Raffles drafts the [Raffles Plan of Singapore](/wiki/Jackson_Plan) to reorganise the island.182327 MayDr [John Crawfurd](/wiki/John_Crawfurd) appointed as second [Resident of the settlement](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Residents_of_Singapore_(1819–1826)).5 June[Raffles Institution](/wiki/Raffles_Institution) is founded by [Sir Stamford Raffles](/wiki/Stamford_Raffles).182417 MarchThe Anglo-Dutch Treaty is signed between Great Britain and the Netherlands.2 AugustSingapore becomes a British colony.1826Singapore becomes part of the British colony of [Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements) under the rule of the [East India Company](/wiki/British_East_India_Company), together with [Malacca](/wiki/Malacca) and [Penang](/wiki/Penang).27 November[Robert Fullerton](/wiki/Robert_Fullerton) was installed as the first [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).1830Singapore comes under the Presidency of [Bengal](/wiki/Bengal) in India.12 November[Robert Ibbetson](/wiki/Robert_Ibbetson) was appointed as the second [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).1832DecemberSingapore becomes the centre of government of the [Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements).18337 December[Kenneth Murchison](/wiki/Kenneth_Murchison) was appointed as the third [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).18341 AugustSingapore Free School was established.183618 November[Sir Samuel George Bonham](/wiki/George_Bonham) was appointed as the fourth [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1946)).1842[St. Margaret's Girls School](/wiki/St._Margaret%27s_Secondary_School) was founded by [Maria Tarn](/wiki/Maria_Tarn) Dyer, the first and oldest all-girls school in Singapore.1843[Thomas Dunman](/wiki/Thomas_Dunman), the first full-time [police chief](/wiki/Police_chief) of Singapore, improves the police force as well as the pay and working hours of policemen.JanuarySingapore became ruled directly from the [British East India Company](/wiki/British_East_India_Company).August[William John Butterworth](/wiki/William_John_Butterworth) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).18444 March[Raffles Girls' School](/wiki/Raffles_Girls%27_School) was established at [Bras Basah Road](/wiki/Bras_Basah_Road).25 JulyThe [Tan Tock Seng Hospital](/wiki/Tan_Tock_Seng_Hospital) begins operation.184515 JulyThe [Straits Times](/wiki/Straits_Times) was established as *The Straits Times and Singapore Journal of Commerce*.1852A new deep harbour called New Harbour, later known as [Keppel Harbour](/wiki/Keppel_Harbour), is built.22 July[St Joseph's Institution](/wiki/St_Joseph%27s_Institution) [as St John's Institution] was established at Bras Basah Road.1854[Convent of the Holy Infant Jesus (CHIJ)](/wiki/CHIJMES) was established.185521 March[Edmund Augustus Blundell](/wiki/Edmund_Augustus_Blundell) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)) upon the retirement of William John Butterworth.1858Singapore is placed under the hierarchy of the Government of India (Calcutta), remaining as part of the [Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements).8 MarchCommercial Square is renamed [Raffles Place](/wiki/Raffles_Place).18596 AugustMajor General Sir [Orfeur Cavenagh](/wiki/Orfeur_Cavenagh) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).The [Singapore Botanic Gardens](/wiki/Singapore_Botanic_Gardens) was founded.18628 September[Saint Andrews School](/wiki/Saint_Andrew%27s_School,_Singapore) was founded at Chin Chew Street.186716 MarchMajor General Sir [Harry St. George Ord](/wiki/Harry_Ord) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).1 April[Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements) become a crown colony of [British Empire](/wiki/British_Empire).The [Legislative Council of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/Legislative_Council_of_the_Straits_Settlements) was formed.186917 NovemberThe [Suez Canal](/wiki/Suez_Canal) opens, and Singapore enjoys the increase in trade.18734 NovemberSir [Andrew Clarke](/wiki/Andrew_Clarke_(British_Army_officer,_born_1824)) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)) upon the retirement of Sir Harry St. George Ord.18758 MaySir [William Jervois](/wiki/William_Jervois) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).1876[Victoria School](/wiki/Victoria_School) was established in Kampong Glam.18773 AprilMajor General [Edward Archibald Harbord Anson](/wiki/Edward_Anson) was appointed as the Acting [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).3 MayThe [Chinese Protectorate](/wiki/Chinese_Protectorate) is set up, and [William Pickering](/wiki/William_A._Pickering) was the first Protector appointed.AugustSir [William Cleaver Francis Robinson](/wiki/William_C._F._Robinson) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).187910 FebruaryMajor General [Edward Archibald Harbord Anson](/wiki/Edward_Anson) was appointed as the Acting [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).188016 MaySir [Frederick Weld](/wiki/Frederick_Weld) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).1885[Gan Eng Seng School](/wiki/Gan_Eng_Seng_School) was established at [Telok Ayer Street](/wiki/Telok_Ayer_Street).18861 March[Anglo-Chinese School](/wiki/Anglo-Chinese_School) was established at [Amoy Street](/wiki/Amoy_Street,_Singapore).188725 July[Methodist Girls' School](/wiki/Methodist_Girls%27_School,_Singapore) was established at Short Street.17 OctoberSir [Cecil Clementi Smith](/wiki/Cecil_Clementi_Smith) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).1 DecemberThe [Raffles Hotel](/wiki/Raffles_Hotel) was established.1888[Henry Ridley](/wiki/Henry_Ridley) becomes the first scientific director of the [Singapore Botanic Gardens](/wiki/Singapore_Botanic_Gardens).The [Singapore Fire Brigade](/wiki/Singapore_Civil_Defence_Force) was formed.1892The Tanjong Pagar Police Station opens, and many [Sikh](/wiki/Sikh) policemen were recruited.[Holy Innocents' High School](/wiki/Holy_Innocents%27_High_School) was established.189330 August[William Edward Maxwell](/wiki/William_Edward_Maxwell) was appointed as the Acting [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1946)).18941 FebruarySir [Charles Bullen Hugh Mitchell](/wiki/Charles_Mitchell_(colonial_administrator)) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).18991 July[Singapore Chinese Girls' School](/wiki/Singapore_Chinese_Girls%27_School) was established at 52 [Hill Street](/wiki/Hill_Street,_Singapore).7 DecemberSir [Charles Bullen Hugh Mitchell](/wiki/Charles_Mitchell_(colonial_administrator)) died while in the office as Governor of the Straits Settlements.[James Alexander Swettenham](/wiki/James_Alexander_Swettenham) was appointed as the Acting [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)). ## 20th century YearDateEvent19011 JanuarySingapore-Kranji Railway officially opened to the public.5 NovemberSir [Frank Swettenham](/wiki/Frank_Swettenham) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).190416 AprilSir [John Anderson](/wiki/John_Anderson_(colonial_administrator)) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).19051 JuneSingapore change its [time zone](/wiki/Singapore_Time) to GMT+07:00 from the original GMT+6hr 55m 25s.190618 NovemberTao Nan School was established.The [Nanyang](/wiki/Nanyang_(region)) branch of [Tongmenghui](/wiki/Tongmenghui) was set up in Singapore.191012 March[Anderson Bridge](/wiki/Anderson_Bridge_(Singapore)) was official opened by Governor Sir [John Anderson](/wiki/John_Anderson_(colonial_administrator)).19112 SeptemberSir [Arthur Young](/wiki/Arthur_Young_(colonial_administrator)) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).19131 JulyThe [Singapore Harbour board](/wiki/PSA_International) was set up.191515 – 25 FebruaryThe [Singapore Mutiny](/wiki/1915_Singapore_Mutiny) occurred as British [Muslim](/wiki/Muslim) Indian [sepoys](/wiki/Sepoy) rose up against the British.191715 August[Nanyang Girls' High School](/wiki/Nanyang_Girls%27_High_School) was established by Tan Chor Nam and Teo Eng Hock, partially due to Dr [Sun Yat Sen](/wiki/Sun_Yat_Sen)'s belief in education for girls, in Dhoby Ghaut.14 June[Nan Hua High School](/wiki/Nan_Hua_High_School) [as Nam Wah Girls' School] established by Mr Xiong Shangfu, its campus in Coleman Street, and it was once a base for the Japanese soldiers during the Japanese occupation.191921 March[The Chinese High School](/wiki/The_Chinese_High_School_(Singapore)) established by [Tan Kah Kee](/wiki/Tan_Kah_Kee) at 15 Niven Road.192017 FebruarySir [Laurence Guillemard](/wiki/Laurence_Guillemard) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).1923Singapore starts constructing the main British [naval base](/wiki/Singapore_Naval_Base) in East Asia.192428 JuneSingapore-Johor Causeway officially opens.19273 JuneSir [Hugh Clifford](/wiki/Hugh_Clifford_(colonial_administrator)) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).7 November[St James Power Station](/wiki/St_James_Power_Station) was officially opened by governor Sir Hugh Clifford.1929[Singapore Police Academy](/wiki/Old_Police_Academy,_Singapore) was established at [Mount Pleasant Road](/wiki/Mount_Pleasant_Road).19305 FebruarySir [Cecil Clementi](/wiki/Cecil_Clementi) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).193215 January[Tanjong Pagar Railway Station](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_railway_station) commenced operation.[Jalan Besar Stadium](/wiki/Jalan_Besar_Stadium) open to the public.19331 JanuarySingapore change its [time zone](/wiki/Singapore_Time) to GMT+07:20.16 January[CHIJ Saint Nicholas Girls' School](/wiki/CHIJ_Saint_Nicholas_Girls%27_School), Singapore's only bilingual and bicultural IJ school, was founded.19349 NovemberSir [Shenton Thomas](/wiki/Shenton_Thomas) was appointed as the [Governor of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_the_Straits_Settlements_(1826–1942)).1935[Catholic High School](/wiki/Catholic_High_School,_Singapore) was established.193712 June[Kallang Airport](/wiki/Kallang_Airport) was opened.1938[British Military Hospital](/wiki/British_Military_Hospital,_Singapore), predecessor of [Alexandra Hospital](/wiki/Alexandra_Hospital) was established.Singapore completes the main British [naval base](/wiki/Singapore_Naval_Base), which is the largest [drydock](/wiki/Drydock) and third largest [floating dock](/wiki/Floating_dock_(jetty)) in the world.193924 January[Chung Cheng High School (Main)](/wiki/Chung_Cheng_High_School_(Main)) was established in Kim Yam Road.1940July[British Military Hospital](/wiki/British_Military_Hospital,_Singapore) at Alexandra Road was officially open.19411 SeptemberSingapore change its [time zone](/wiki/Singapore_Time) to GMT+07:30.7 – 8 DecemberIn an extensive [three-pronged attack](/wiki/Attack_on_Pearl_Harbor), Japan opens hostilities with the countries that opposed the [Axis powers](/wiki/Axis_powers) and their colonies. First air raid on Singapore at 4:15 am. The [Imperial Japanese Army](/wiki/Imperial_Japanese_Army) [invades Malaya](/wiki/Malayan_campaign).10 DecemberThe British battleship [HMS *Prince of Wales*](/wiki/HMS_Prince_of_Wales_(53)) and battlecruiser [HMS *Repulse*](/wiki/HMS_Repulse_(1916)) are sunk by Japanese bombers.16 DecemberSecond air raid on Singapore, at night. Only RAF Tengah is attacked.25 DecemberA lone Japanese aircraft drops propaganda pamphlets on Singapore Island.29 DecemberSecond Japanese air raid on Singapore City (and third on the island), at night. Nightly raids commence.30 DecemberThe Overseas Chinese Mobilization Council is set up in Singapore, led by Tan Kah Kee.194212 JanuaryFirst major daylight air raid on Singapore. Henceforth, the island is bombed everyday up to the British surrender (with the exception of 19 January).31 January[Malaya](/wiki/British_Malaya) falls to the Japanese and the Causeway is blown up to delay Japan's advancement to Singapore.1 FebruaryThe siege of Singapore begins. The Japanese in Johor Bahru begin shelling the island daily in addition to daily aerial bombing.8 FebruaryThe Japanese cross the [Straits of Johor](/wiki/Straits_of_Johor) by inflatable boats and landed in Singapore during the [Battle of Singapore](/wiki/Battle_of_Singapore).11 FebruaryThe Japanese and Allied soldiers fight fiercely at [Bukit Timah](/wiki/Bukit_Timah).13 FebruaryThe Malay regiment, led by Lt. [Adnan bin Saidi](/wiki/Adnan_bin_Saidi), fight bravely against the Japanese at *Pasir Panjang Ridge* in the [Battle of Pasir Panjang](/wiki/Battle_of_Pasir_Panjang).14 FebruaryThe Japanese have captured most of Singapore, and most of the population is crammed into the city centre.15 FebruaryThe British surrenders and the [Japanese occupation of Singapore](/wiki/Japanese_occupation_of_Singapore) starts. Singapore is renamed Syonan-to (Light of the South Island).Singapore change its [time zone](/wiki/Singapore_Time) to GMT+09:00 to be the same as Japan.18 February – 4 MarchThe Japanese military police, the [Kempeitai](/wiki/Kempeitai) kills an estimated 25,000 to 50,000 people during [Sook Ching Massacre](/wiki/Sook_Ching_Massacre).194327 September[Operation Jaywick](/wiki/Operation_Jaywick) occurred. Seven Japanese ships are bombed at Clifford Pier.10 OctoberThe Japanese initiate the Double Tenth Incident in response to Operation Jaywick, by launching a fierce crackdown on anti-Japanese elements and Allied prisoners-of-war in Singapore.194427 March[Lim Bo Seng](/wiki/Lim_Bo_Seng) is captured by the Japanese, and dies after 3 months of torture.194514 AugustJapan surrenders, and there is [anomie](/wiki/Anomie) and [looting](/wiki/Looting) for nearly a month when the British do not return immediately.5 SeptemberThe British return to Singapore after the end of World War II and begin the [British Military Administration of the Straits Settlements](/wiki/British_Military_Administration_(Malaya)) under the command of [Lord Louis Mountbatten](/wiki/Lord_Mountbatten).12 SeptemberSingapore revert its [time zone](/wiki/Singapore_Time) back to the pre-war time of GMT+07:30.19461 AprilThe Straits Settlements is dissolved and Singapore becomes a separate crown colony.The [Legislative Council of the Colony of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Council_of_Singapore) was formed.Sir [Franklin Charles Gimson](/wiki/Franklin_Gimson) was appointed as the [Governor of the Singapore](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_Singapore_(1946–1959)).1947A large number of strikes occur causing stoppages in public transport, public services and the harbour.MaySevere food shortage leads to record-low rice ration, causing malnutrition, disease and outbreak of crime and violence.194820 March24 JuneRubber plantations and tin mines in Malaya are destroyed by communists, and the British declares the state of [Emergency over Singapore and Malaya](/wiki/Malayan_Emergency). The emergency was officially lifted on 31 July 1960 by the Malayan government.1949The [University of Malaya](/wiki/University_of_Malaya) is formed following the merger of [Raffles College](/wiki/Raffles_College) and [King Edward Medical College](/wiki/King_Edward_Medical_College_(Singapore)).195011 – 13 DecemberThe **[Maria Hertogh riots](/wiki/Maria_Hertogh_riots)** occur. 18 people are killed.195110 AprilThe number of elected seats is increased to 9 in the second election.195220 March[Wilfred Lawson Blythe](/wiki/Wilfred_Lawson_Blythe) was appointed as the Acting [Governor of the Singapore](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_Singapore_(1946–1959)).21 AprilSir [John Fearns Nicoll](/wiki/John_Fearns_Nicoll) was appointed as the [Governor of the Singapore](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_Singapore_(1946–1959)).1953[Rendel Commission](/wiki/Rendel_Commission) is appointed to make recommendations for Singapore's self-government.195413 MayChinese school students demonstrate against the British due to the National Service proposal. See [Anti-National Service Riots](/wiki/1954_National_Service_riots)19552 April12 MayFour people are killed during the [Hock Lee bus riots](/wiki/Hock_Lee_bus_riots).2 June[William Goode](/wiki/William_Goode_(colonial_administrator)) was appointed as the Acting [Governor of the Singapore](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_Singapore_(1946–1959)).30 JuneSir [Robert Black](/wiki/Robin_Black_(colonial_administrator)) was appointed as the [Governor of the Singapore](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_Singapore_(1946–1959)).20 August[Kallang Airport](/wiki/Kallang_Airport) ceased operation. [Paya Lebar Airport](/wiki/Paya_Lebar_Air_Base) started operation.19569 January[Anglican High School](/wiki/Anglican_High_School,_Singapore) was founded by the Chinese speaking congregations of the Anglican Churches in Singapore.7 June[David Marshall](/wiki/David_Marshall_(Singaporean_politician)) appeals to the United Kingdom for full self-government, but resigns when he fails. [Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock) takes over as Chief Minister.10 October[Riots by pro-communist Chinese school students](/wiki/Chinese_middle_school_student_riots) occur when government closes down a student union on 24 September 1956.14 October[Dunman High School](/wiki/Dunman_High_School) (formally known as Singapore Government Chinese Middle School), became the first Chinese secondary school established by the government.1957[Cedar Girls' Secondary School](/wiki/Cedar_Girls%27_Secondary_School) was founded.9 DecemberSir [William Goode](/wiki/William_Goode_(colonial_administrator)) was appointed as the [Governor of the Singapore](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore#Governors_of_Singapore_(1946–1959)).1959March30 May3rd general elections (limited self-government) held. [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) wins 43 of 51 seats and [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) became the first [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore).3 JuneA celebration is held at the [Padang](/wiki/Padang,_Singapore) for Singapore gaining full self-government.Sir [William Goode](/wiki/William_Goode_(colonial_administrator)) becomes the [Yang di-Pertuan Negara](/wiki/Yang_di-Pertuan_Negara) of Singapore.3 DecemberThe national anthem *[Majulah Singapura](/wiki/Majulah_Singapura)*, written by [Zubir Said](/wiki/Zubir_Said), is presented.[Encik Yusof bin Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak) becomes the [Yang di-Pertuan Negara](/wiki/Yang_di-Pertuan_Negara) of Singapore.19601 FebruaryThe [Housing and Development Board](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board) is set up.8 September[Tan Howe Liang](/wiki/Tan_Howe_Liang) became Singapore's first Olympic medalist. He finished second among 35 competitors in the lightweight category in weightlifting at the 1960 games held in Rome, Italy.196125 MayThe [Bukit Ho Swee fire](/wiki/Bukit_Ho_Swee_fire) kills four people and destroys 2,200 attap houses.27 May[Tunku Abdul Rahman](/wiki/Tunku_Abdul_Rahman), the Prime Minister of [Malaya](/wiki/Federation_of_Malaya), proposes a merger between Singapore, Malaya, [Sabah](/wiki/Sabah) and [Sarawak](/wiki/Sarawak).19621 September[A referendum](/wiki/1962_Singaporean_integration_referendum) is held in Singapore to vote on merger with Malaysia.19632 FebruaryDuring [Operation Coldstore](/wiki/Operation_Coldstore), 107 left-wing politicians and trade unionists are arrested by [Internal Security Department](/wiki/Internal_Security_Department_(Singapore))9 JulyThe [Malaysia Agreement](/wiki/Malaysia_Agreement) is signed between leaders of Malaya, Singapore, [Sabah](/wiki/Sabah) and [Sarawak](/wiki/Sarawak).31 AugustIn this Malaysia Solidarity Day, [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) declares de facto Independence for Singapore.16 SeptemberMalaysia is formed. [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia) carries out its [konfrontasi](/wiki/Konfrontasi) campaign.[Encik Yusof bin Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak) becomes the [Yang di-Pertuan Negara](/wiki/Yang_di-Pertuan_Negara) of [Singapura](/wiki/Singapore_in_Malaysia).21 SeptemberThe PAP wins the [1963 State Elections](/wiki/1963_Singaporean_general_election), defeating the [Barisan Sosialis](/wiki/Barisan_Sosialis) and [UMNO](/wiki/UMNO).196425 AprilThe PAP wins one seat in the Malaysian Federal Election. [UMNO is outraged](/wiki/PAP%E2%80%93UMNO_relations).21 JulyAn [ethnic riot](/wiki/1964_race_riots_in_Singapore) between various Malays and Chinese, on Prophet [Muhammad](/wiki/Muhammad)'s birthday, 23 people are killed.196510 MarchIndonesian [saboteurs](/wiki/Saboteurs) carry out the [MacDonald House bombing](/wiki/MacDonald_House_bombing), killing three people.May[Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) begins campaigning for a [Malaysian Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysian_Malaysia)7 AugustSingapore and Malaysia sign the separation agreement.9 AugustThe Malaysian Parliament votes to expel Singapore from the Federation; Singapore becomes independent after separating from Malaysia.21 SeptemberSingapore is admitted into the [United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations) as the 117th member.15 OctoberSingapore becomes the 23rd member of the [Commonwealth of Nations](/wiki/Commonwealth_of_Nations).22 DecemberConstitutional Amendment Act is passed and [Encik Yusof bin Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak) becomes the first [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore).19663 AugustSingapore became the 104th member of the [International Monetary Fund](/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund) (IMF) and the [World Bank](/wiki/World_Bank).24 AugustThe first daily recitation of the pledge of allegiance before the national flag was taken by 500,000 students at all 529 government and aided schools.1967The Civilian Memorial is unveiled at the [Kranji War Cemetery](/wiki/Kranji_War_Cemetery)14 MarchThe [National Service](/wiki/National_service_in_Singapore) bill is passed in the [parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore).28 March – 18 AprilRegistrations for [national service](/wiki/National_service_in_Singapore) begins at the Central Manpower Base.12 JuneThe issue of the first [Singapore dollar](/wiki/Singapore_dollar).8 AugustSingapore joined the [Association of Southeast Asian Nations](/wiki/Association_of_Southeast_Asian_Nations) (ASEAN) as one of the founding members.17 AugustThe first batch of the army is drafted for [national service](/wiki/National_service_in_Singapore).1968JanuaryBritain announces its intention to withdraw its armed forces from Singapore.19 AprilThe PAP wins all seats in the [1968 General Election](/wiki/1968_Singaporean_general_election), which is boycotted by [Barisan Sosialis](/wiki/Barisan_Sosialis).National Archives was established.196920 JanuaryThe [National Junior College](/wiki/National_Junior_College), Singapore's first junior college was established.31 MayThe [1969 race riots of Singapore](/wiki/1969_race_riots_of_Singapore) broke out after growing tension of the [13 May incident](/wiki/13_May_incident) in Malaysia spilled over to Singapore.197023 November[Encik Yusof bin Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak), first [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore) died while in office.19712 JanuaryDr [Benjamin Henry Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Henry_Sheares) becomes the second [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore).31 OctoberThe last British military forces withdraws from Singapore.19722 SeptemberThe PAP wins the [1972 General Election](/wiki/1972_Singaporean_general_election).1 OctoberThe [Singapore Airlines](/wiki/Singapore_Airlines) is formed.19734 FebruaryThe first [Chingay parade](/wiki/Chingay_parade) is held in Singapore.14 JulyThe [Presidential Council for Minority Rights](/wiki/Presidential_Council_for_Minority_Rights) is set up to ensure minority would not be discriminated.21 JulyThe construction of the [National Stadium](/wiki/Former_National_Stadium,_Singapore) is completed and open in Kallang.197415 January[Hwa Chong Junior College](/wiki/Hwa_Chong_Junior_College), Singapore's first government-aided junior college was established.31 January[Laju incident](/wiki/Laju_incident): [Japanese Red Army](/wiki/Japanese_Red_Army) bombs petroleum tanks at [Pulau Bukom](/wiki/Pulau_Bukom) and hijacks a ferry boat.MarchThe construction of [Jurong Town Hall](/wiki/Jurong_Town_Hall) is completed.197623 DecemberThe PAP wins all 69 seats in the [1976 General Election](/wiki/1976_Singaporean_general_election).[St James Power Station](/wiki/St_James_Power_Station) was decommissioned and its operations is taken over by Pasir Panjang and Jurong power stations.197812 October[Spyros disaster](/wiki/Spyros_disaster), was a major industrial disaster which claimed 76 lives.19791 JuneFirst National Courtesy Campaign was launched.Singapore becomes the world's second busiest port in terms of shipping tonnage.198023 DecemberThe [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) wins all 75 seats in the [1980 General Election](/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election).198112 MayDr [Benjamin Henry Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Henry_Sheares) (second [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore)) died while in office.1 JulyPaya Lebar Airport ceased operation and [Singapore Changi Airport](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport) starts operation.23 October[C V Devan Nair](/wiki/C_V_Devan_Nair) becomes the third [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore).31 October[Workers' Party of Singapore](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_of_Singapore)'s [Joshua Benjamin Jeyaretnam](/wiki/Joshua_Benjamin_Jeyaretnam) elected into Parliament, breaking a 16 years PAP monopoly of the House.19821 JanuarySingapore change its [time zone](/wiki/Singapore_Time) to UTC+08:00.The *Civil Defence Programme* are launched.198329 January([Singapore Cable Car disaster](/wiki/Singapore_Cable_Car_disaster)) Eniwetok, a Panamanian-registered oil rig, hits the [Singapore Cable Car](/wiki/Singapore_Cable_Car) system, sending two cabins plunging into the sea and killing seven people.198422 August[Non-Constituency Member of Parliament](/wiki/Non-Constituency_Member_of_Parliament) was introduced.22 DecemberThe PAP wins the [1984 General Election](/wiki/1984_Singaporean_general_election) while two members of the opposition parties are elected as members of [parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore). Three PAP women MPs are also elected, ending a 16 years absence of women representation in Parliament.198528 March[C V Devan Nair](/wiki/C_V_Devan_Nair) stepped down as the third [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore).2 September[Wee Kim Wee](/wiki/Wee_Kim_Wee) becomes the fourth [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore).Singapore went into its first ever recession which was induced by government policies.198615 March[Collapse of Hotel New World](/wiki/Collapse_of_Hotel_New_World), killing 33 people and injuring 17 others.198721 May16 people were arrested during [Operation Spectrum](/wiki/Operation_Spectrum) and detained under the [Internal Security Act](/wiki/Internal_Security_Act_(Singapore)). Another six were arrested on 20 June.19883 SeptemberThe PAP wins the [1988 General Election](/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election) and [group representation constituencies](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) (GRC)s are introduced.19906 JulyThe [East–West Line](/wiki/East%E2%80%93West_Line_(Singapore)) of the [Mass Rapid Transit](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)) (MRT) is completed.22 November[Singapore Changi Airport](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport) Terminal 2 begins operation.28 November[Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong) becomes the second [Prime Minister of Singapore](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore).199126 MarchFour Pakistanis hijack [Singapore Airlines Flight 117](/wiki/Singapore_Airlines_Flight_117) and demand the release of [Pakistan Peoples Party](/wiki/Pakistan_Peoples_Party) members from Pakistani jails.27 MarchMembers of the [Singapore Special Operations Force](/wiki/Singapore_Special_Operations_Force) storm into [Singapore Airlines Flight 117](/wiki/Singapore_Airlines_Flight_117), killing all hijackers and freeing all passengers and crew members.31 August[General elections](/wiki/1991_Singaporean_general_election) are held. The result is a victory for the [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party), which wins 77 out of 81 seats.1993August[National Archives of Singapore](/wiki/National_Archives_of_Singapore) was formed.1 September[Ong Teng Cheong](/wiki/Ong_Teng_Cheong) becomes the first elected President and fifth [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore).19945 MayAmerican teenager [Michael P. Fay](/wiki/Michael_P._Fay) is convicted and caned for [vandalism](/wiki/Vandalism).1996The [parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) passes the *Maintenance of Parents* law, a private member's bill introduced by [Nominated Member of Parliament](/wiki/Nominated_Member_of_Parliament) [Woon Cheong Ming Walter](/wiki/Woon_Cheong_Ming_Walter).19972 January[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) led by [Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong) wins a total of 81 out of 83 seats in the [1997 general election](/wiki/1997_Singapore_general_election).19 December[Silkair Flight 185](/wiki/Silkair_Flight_185) crashes into Musi River near [Palembang](/wiki/Palembang), [Sumatra](/wiki/Sumatra), killing all 104 people on board.199815 JanuarySingapore and United States announces agreement for US ships to use a planned $35 million naval base from 2000.September"The Singapore Story", the first volume of [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew)'s memoirs is published. (Li, Guangyao; Lee, Kuan Yew (1998). *The Singapore Story: Memoirs of Lee Kuan Yew*. Prentice-Hall. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-0130208033.)19991 September[S. R. Nathan](/wiki/S._R._Nathan) becomes the sixth [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore).Singapore slips into recession during the [1997 Asian financial crisis](/wiki/1997_Asian_financial_crisis).20001 September[Speakers' Corner](/wiki/Speakers%27_Corner,_Singapore) is launched at [Hong Lim Park](/wiki/Hong_Lim_Park).31 October[Singapore Airlines Flight 006](/wiki/Singapore_Airlines_Flight_006) crashes during take-off in [Chiang Kai Shek International Airport](/wiki/Chiang_Kai_Shek_International_Airport), killing 83 people."From Third World to First, The Singapore Story 1965-2000" the second volume of [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew)'s memoirs is published. (*From Third World to First, The Singapore Story 1965-2000*. 3 August 1998. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-9812049841.) ## 21st century YearDateEvent2001Economic recession in Singapore. (to 2003)JanuaryA pipeline feeding gas to Singapore from [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia)'s [Natuna field](/wiki/Natuna_field) in [South China Sea](/wiki/South_China_Sea) opens.3 NovemberThe [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) wins 82 of 84 seats in the [2001 General Election](/wiki/2001_Singapore_general_election).9 December15 suspected militants of [Jemaah Islamiah](/wiki/Jemaah_Islamiah) are arrested for alleged bomb plot.27 December[Tropical Storm Vamei](/wiki/Tropical_Storm_Vamei), a rare tropic storm that occurs only once in 100 to 400 years, hits Singapore.200213 JanuarySingapore and Japan sign the *Japan-Singapore Economic Agreement*.12 OctoberThe [Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay](/wiki/Esplanade_%E2%80%93_Theatres_on_the_Bay) officially opened as Singapore's major performing arts centre.20031 March - 16 July[SARS](/wiki/SARS) virus outbreak in Singapore.6 MaySingapore and United States sign the [United States-Singapore Free Trade Agreement](/wiki/United_States-Singapore_Free_Trade_Agreement) (USS-FTA).29 OctoberA major research center [Biopolis](/wiki/Biopolis) opens.200420 AprilA section of [Nicoll Highway collapses](/wiki/Nicoll_Highway_collapse), killing 4 people.12 August[Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong), Lee Kuan Yew's son becomes the third [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore).December[National Service](/wiki/National_Service) was reduced from two and half years to two years.200515 JanuarySingapore and [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia) settle dispute over land reclamation work.18 AprilThe government approves the plan to legalise [casino](/wiki/Casino)-gambling and build two [Integrated Resorts](/wiki/Integrated_Resort).8 JulyIn the aftermath of 7 July 2005 – London bombings, Transport Minister [Yeo Cheow Tong](/wiki/Yeo_Cheow_Tong) announces plan to set up a new [Police MRT Unit](/wiki/Police_MRT_Unit) to enhance the security of [Singapore's public transport](/wiki/Transportation_in_Singapore). (CNA) Archived 25 July 2009 at the [Wayback Machine](/wiki/Wayback_Machine)17 August[S R Nathan](/wiki/S_R_Nathan) returns for his second term as [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore), following a walkover in the [2005 Singapore presidential election](/wiki/2005_Singapore_presidential_election).27 AugustWhite Elephant Incident at [Buangkok MRT station](/wiki/Buangkok_MRT_station).31 December[Singapore Police Academy](/wiki/Old_Police_Academy,_Singapore) ceased operational. [Home Team Academy](/wiki/Home_Team_Academy) replaces the Police Academy and went operational on the following day at Old Choa Chu Kang Road.20066 MayThe [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party), led by [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong), wins 82 of 84 seats in the [General Election](/wiki/2006_Singapore_general_election).26 March[Singapore Changi Airport](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport) opens the Budget Terminal.200720 MayThe [Marina Bay Floating Platform](/wiki/The_Float_@_Marina_Bay) was opened.30 JuneThe [Former National Stadium](/wiki/Former_National_Stadium,_Singapore) was closed for re-construction.20089 January[Singapore Changi Airport](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport) opens its [third passenger terminal](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport_Terminal_3).21 FebruaryThe International Olympic Committee (IOC) awards the Youth Olympic Games hosting rights to Singapore ahead of Moscow by a vote of 53 to 44.27 FebruaryJemiah Islamiah terrorist head [Mas Selamat](/wiki/Mas_Selamat) bin Kastari escapes from prison.SeptemberSingapore slips into recession due to the [2008 financial crisis](/wiki/2008_financial_crisis). World economies hit badly; banks around the world collapse.16 OctoberSingapore government guarantees all local and foreign currency fixed deposits with a $150 billion pool due to the [2008 financial crisis](/wiki/2008_financial_crisis), joining governments around the world.20117 MayPAP loses its grip on [Aljunied Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Aljunied_Group_Representation_Constituency) to the Workers' Party in the [General Election](/wiki/2011_Singapore_general_election). This is the first time an opposition party has captured a GRC since the inception of this scheme in 1988.1 JulyTanjong Pagar Railway Station ceased operation and to be reserved as the Singapore Railway Museum.27 AugustSingaporeans, for the first time since the establishment of Presidential Election, will be voting for the next President after the 6th President of Singapore – [SR Nathan](/wiki/SR_Nathan) stepped down on 31 August 2011. The candidates involves in this election includes – Dr [Tan Keng Yam Tony](/wiki/Tan_Keng_Yam_Tony), Mr [Tan Jee Say](/wiki/Tan_Jee_Say), Mr [Tan Kin Lian](/wiki/Tan_Kin_Lian) and Dr. [Tan Cheng Bock](/wiki/Tan_Cheng_Bock).1 SeptemberDr [Tan Keng Yam Tony](/wiki/Tan_Keng_Yam_Tony) is sworn as the seventh [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore).201225 September[Singapore Changi Airport](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport) closes The Budget Terminal to make way for the construction of future [Singapore Changi Airport Terminal 4](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport_Terminal_4).201316 FebruaryMore than 3000 Singaporeans gathered at the [Speakers' Corner, Singapore](/wiki/Speakers%27_Corner,_Singapore) at [Hong Lim Park](/wiki/Hong_Lim_Park) for a non-partisan protest against the government's Population [White Paper](/wiki/White_Paper) which projected a possible 6.9 million people in Singapore by 2030.24 JuneHaze in Singapore reaches 401 PSI, the worst in Singapore history.8 DecemberThe [2013 Little India riot](/wiki/2013_Little_India_riot) took place after a fatal accident occurred at the junction of Race Course Road and Hampshire Road in [Little India, Singapore](/wiki/Little_India,_Singapore).201412 JanuaryBeginning construction of the new [Thomson–East Coast MRT line](/wiki/Thomson%E2%80%93East_Coast_Line) (Thomson stretch) consisting of 31 new stations (including 7 interchanges).30 JuneThe new [National Stadium](/wiki/National_Stadium,_Singapore) re-opened to the public after re-construction.201523 MarchLee Kuan Yew passes away. Singapore enters a one-week mourning period.30 June[Ng Teng Fong General Hospital](/wiki/Ng_Teng_Fong_General_Hospital) commences operation.22 July[Jurong Community Hospital](/wiki/Jurong_Community_Hospital) commences operation.9 AugustSingapore turns 50.11 SeptemberThe PAP wins 83 of 89 seats in the [2015 General Election](/wiki/2015_Singaporean_general_election).201621 JulyBeginning construction of the new [Thomson–East Coast MRT line](/wiki/Thomson%E2%80%93East_Coast_Line) (East Coast stretch).22 AugustS R Nathan passes away. Singapore enters a one-week mourning period.201711 FebruaryNearly 300 year old Tembusu tree at Singapore Botanic Gardens falls, killing one and injured 4 others.17 April[Othman Wok](/wiki/Othman_Wok) passes away. Singapore enters a one-week mourning period.13–14 September[Halimah Yacob](/wiki/Halimah_Yacob) is elected as the first female president and eighth [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore).31 October[Singapore Changi Airport](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport) opens its [fourth passenger terminal](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport_Terminal_4).201812 JuneSingapore hosted the [Singapore Summit](/wiki/2018_North_Korea%E2%80%93United_States_Singapore_Summit), a summit meeting between North Korea and United States leaders.18 August[Sengkang General Hospital](/wiki/Sengkang_General_Hospital) opened to public.19 NovemberA new passenger terminal in [Seletar Airport](/wiki/Seletar_Airport) opened, replacing the old building.201928 JanuarySingapore celebrates the 200th Anniversary of the [foundation of modern Singapore](/wiki/Founding_years_of_modern_Singapore) by [Stamford Raffles](/wiki/Stamford_Raffles).17 April[Jewel Changi Airport](/wiki/Jewel_Changi_Airport) opens after a week-long preview.202023 JanuaryThe [first COVID-19](/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Singapore) case in Singapore was confirmed involving a 66-year-old Chinese national from Wuhan.10 JulyThe PAP wins 83 of 93 seats in the [2020 General Election](/wiki/2020_Singaporean_general_election).20221 AprilSingapore transition to the [phase](/wiki/Endemic_phase_of_COVID-19) of [Living with COVID-19 endemic](/wiki/Living_with_COVID).2023MayThe [CPIB](/wiki/Corrupt_Practices_Investigation_Bureau) of Singapore investigates Ministers [K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam) and [Vivian Balakrishnan](/wiki/Vivian_Balakrishnan) after accusations regarding their Ridout Road state-owned bungalows rentals.5 June[Raffles Institution](/wiki/Raffles_Institution) celebrates its bicentennial (200th year).11-12 JulyMinister of Transport [S. Iswaran](/wiki/S._Iswaran) and tycoon [Ong Beng Seng](/wiki/Ong_Beng_Seng) is arrested as part of a [CPIB](/wiki/Corrupt_Practices_Investigation_Bureau) probe.17 JulySpeaker of Parliament [Tan Chuan-Jin](/wiki/Tan_Chuan-Jin) and MP for Tampines GRC (Tampines East) [Cheng Li Hui](/wiki/Cheng_Li_Hui) simultaneously resign due to "propriety and personal conduct". Investigations into the matter confirmed that both were having an extramarital affair.19 JulyMP for Aljunied GRC (Serangoon) [Leon Perera](/wiki/Leon_Perera) and [Nicole Seah](/wiki/Nicole_Seah) resign from office due to a leaked video showing an inappropriate exchange between the two. Later it was found that they were having an extramarital affair.14 September[Tharman Shanmugaratnam](/wiki/Tharman_Shanmugaratnam) is sworn in as Singapore’s ninth [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore). He is the first non-Chinese presidential candidate to win in a contested presidential election in Singapore.202418 January[S. Iswaran](/wiki/S._Iswaran) resigns as [Minister for Transport](/wiki/Ministry_of_Transport_(Singapore)), Member of Parliament for [West Coast GRC](/wiki/West_Coast_Group_Representation_Constituency), and from [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) after being [charged with 27 counts relating to bribery and corruption](/wiki/Prosecution_of_S_Iswaran) by the [CPIB](/wiki/Corrupt_Practices_Investigation_Bureau). [Chee Hong Tat](/wiki/Chee_Hong_Tat) succeeds Iswaran as Transport Minister.28 February[Ahmed Salim](/wiki/Ahmed_Salim_(murderer)) becomes the first death row offender executed for murder in Singapore since 2019. The Bangladeshi painter was convicted for killing his Indonesian ex-girlfriend in 2018.2 MarchFormer [Raffles Institution](/wiki/Raffles_Institution) headmaster and historian [Eugene Wijeysingha](/wiki/Eugene_Wijeysingha), died at age 90.2 AprilSwimmer [Joseph Schooling](/wiki/Joseph_Schooling), who won [Singapore's first ever Olympic gold medal](/wiki/Singapore_at_the_Olympics#List_of_medalists), retires from swimming at 28.15 April[Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong) announces his resignation as the 3rd [Prime Minister of Singapore](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore) effective on 15 May 2024. [Deputy Prime Minister](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore) and [Finance Minister](/wiki/Ministry_of_Finance_(Singapore)#Ministers) [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) will assume the position of the 4th Prime Minister of Singapore.22 AprilA six-car collision at the junction of Tampines Avenue 1 and 4 results in the death of two [Malay Singaporeans](/wiki/Malay_Singaporeans): 17-year-old [Temasek Junior College](/wiki/Temasek_Junior_College) student and a 57-year-old woman.15 May[Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) is sworn in as the fourth [Prime Minister of Singapore](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore), succeeding [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong).21 May[Singapore Airlines Flight 321](/wiki/Singapore_Airlines_Flight_321), flying from [London](/wiki/London) to [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) makes an [emergency landing](/wiki/Emergency_landing) at [Bangkok](/wiki/Bangkok)'s [Suvarnabhumi Airport](/wiki/Suvarnabhumi_Airport) after experiencing severe [air turbulence](/wiki/Clear-air_turbulence) over the [Bay of Bengal](/wiki/Bay_of_Bengal), resulting in one death and at least 71 injured.14 JuneAn [accident involving a Dutch-flagged dredger and a stationary Singapore-flagged bunker vessel](/wiki/2024_Singapore_oil_spill) occurs at the [Pasir Panjang](/wiki/Pasir_Panjang) terminal, causing an [oil spill](/wiki/Oil_spill) that forces the closure of three beaches in [Sentosa Island](/wiki/Sentosa_Island). - Lepoer, Barbara Leitch, ed., *Singapore: A Country Study*. Washington: GPO for the Library of Congress, 1989.
